    NOPLogger  
    OutputStreamSimpleLogger  
    QueueSimpleLogger<E extends QueueSimpleLogger.Event>
    A SimpleLogger that adds every log event to a Queue of QueueSimpleLogger.Event's (or possibly extensions thereof) It is abstract because you need to implement how to instantiate a new QueueSimpleLogger.Event extension for the queue via QueueSimpleLogger.createEvent(Level, CharSequence, Throwable) If you have no need for that, you can instantiate via QueueSimpleLogger.of(Queue).
    QueueSimpleLogger.Event
    A representation of a log event

    Wraps an SLF4J Logger
    StringBuilderSimpleLogger
    Simply logs everything to a StringBuilder.
    StringBuilderSimpleLogger.Builder  
    StringSupplierChainedSimpleLogger  

Package nl.vpro.logging.simple Description

Available logging frameworks are sometimes a bit hard. The de facto standard at vpro is slf4j. Its interface is however hard to completely implement. SimpleLogger is much easier. A complete implementation may be just a few lines. Performance is not a key goal of this framework. The main goal is easy of implementation. The basic idea is that a logger is not much more then a consumer of messages. These could be written to some logger framework, but sometimes you want to do something else with it too. E.g. collecting it in JMX calls, or throwing it on web sockets so that web site users can see them too. A SimpleLogger therefor is a good choice if methods use some Logger as an argument. The method is somewhat restricted, but the caller can decide what to do with logging very easily.
Since:
1.77
Author:
Michiel Meeuwissen
